Clinical Neuroradiology Consulting

Get accurate brain and spine diagnosis from our board-certified neuroradiology consultants. Consult Our Expert Team!

Second opinions + complex diagnosis

Advanced interpretation for brain, spine, and spinal cord findings.

Expanded modality expertise

DTI, fMRI, perfusion, spectroscopy, PET, SPECT, and CT perfusion.

Protocol and workflow guidance

Improve clinical accuracy, efficiency, and patient outcomes.

Advanced Clinical Neuroradiology Consulting from Neuro Experts, PC

The nervous system is the most crucial part of the human body, and any harm caused to it can be devastating or even life-threatening. For patients who need quick diagnosis and treatment of neurological conditions, we offer neuroradiology services to diagnose and guide treatment of abnormalities found in the brain, spine, spinal cord, and neck.

Our experts have exclusive skills in interpreting advanced neuroimaging such as Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI), functional MRI (fMRI), MR perfusion, Arterial Spine Labeling (ASL), MR spectroscopy, CT perfusion, Positron Emission Tomography (PET), and Single-photon emission computed tomography (SPECT) imaging.

Need more help with clinical neuroradiology? Consult our team of experts today.

DTI Neuroimaging

One of the advanced services we offer is Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) interpretation, a state-of-the-art MRI technique that determines the integrity of the white matter tracts of the brain by measuring water diffusion within these tracts. The utility of DTI neuroimaging includes:

White Matter Imaging

With DTI imaging, neuroradiologists can get insights into white matter integrity and anatomy, which is essential for evaluation of conditions like traumatic brain injury and brain tumors.

Detection of Traumatic Axonal Injury

Susceptibility Weighted Imaging (SWI) and Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) can be effective in identifying traumatic axonal injuries, which occur when the brain's connectivity is damaged.

Comprehensive Mapping of Fiber Tracts

Diffusion tensor imaging in tumor imaging and traumatic brain injury is also used to create detailed maps of fiber tracts in the human brain.

Precision in Image-Guided Procedures

DTI and functional MRI (fMRI) can also be used to guide neurosurgical procedures such as tumor resection or deep brain stimulator placement.

Advanced Clinical Research Opportunities

DTI and functional MRI open new doors for clinical research into neurological disorders. Researchers can use these imaging methods to assess the human brain and neural network.

Perfusion Imaging

Perfusion images help assess blood flow to different regions of the brain and are especially useful in diagnosing conditions such as stroke, brain tumors, and certain types of dementia.

Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy (MRS)

With MRS, we measure the levels of specific chemicals in the brain tissue to diagnose and monitor conditions like brain tumors and metabolic disorders.

Why Neuroradiology?

Neuroradiology is a specialized branch of radiology focused on the imaging and diagnosis of diseases related to the central nervous system (CNS), brain, head, neck, and spine. Our expert neuroradiologists use magnetic fields, X-rays, and advanced imaging technologies to get highly detailed images of the human brain and spinal cord.

Why Choose Us?

  • Expertise in Advanced Imaging: Our specialists have exclusive expertise in interpreting advanced neuro-imaging techniques.
  • Personalized, Patient-Centered Care: We guide customized treatment plans by working with neurologists, neurosurgeons, pain specialists, and other clinicians.
  • Commitment to Clinical Research: Our experts have many years of experience in investigations of diagnostic and treatment modalities in neurological disorders such as epilepsy, dementia, stroke, and traumatic brain injury (TBI). Their clinical and academic expertise allows them to lead large-scale projects in the field of neurosciences.

Need help with your research project? Consult our team of experts today.
